A check dam would be constructed across the Kallar at Siruvalur in Ariyalur taluk at a cost of Rs. 1 crore. District Collector E. Saravanavelraj, in a release, said the State government has accorded administrative sanction for the project, which would help harness the flood flow in the Kallar. About 68.50 acres of agricultural land would benefit from the construction of the dam, he said. Mr. Saravanavelraj said that work on construction of check dam across Thamarai Odai at Kallankurichi, at a cost of Rs. 73 lakh, was under way. The construction of the check dam would help improve the water table and stabilise irrigation on about 16.51 acres of land.

EVMs arrive

Another batch of electronic voting machines which are to be used for the Assembly election in the district arrived here from Bihar on Saturday. An official release said that 500 control units and 114 ballot units were brought from Bihar by a team of Revenue officials who had gone there. The machines were later kept in safe custody at the Sub Collector’s Office at Perambalur in the presence of all-party representatives. Already, 727 ballot units and 860 control units have been received here from Gujarat, an official release said.
